title: Brandy Norwood
summary: Brandy Rayana Norwood (born February 11, 1979), better known by her mononym Brandy, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She is known for her distinctive sound, characterized by her peculiar timbre, voice-layering, and intricate riffs, which has earned her the title of "the Vocal Bible".[1] As of August 2020, she has sold over 40 million records worldwide, with approximately 8.62 million albums sold in the United States alone.[2][3] Her work has earned her numerous awards and accolades, including a Grammy Award, an American Music Award, and seven Billboard Music Awards.
